#) Hyperglycemia: Elevated glucose, serum osm, lack of anion gap, and absence of urine ketones suggest HHS. #) A-fib: New onset a-fib. Differential includes fluid overload, hyperthyroidism, pre-existing structural heart disease (LAH, mitral regurg/stenosis). #) Troponin leak: In the absence of chest pain/angina or concerning EKG changes, this likely represents heart strain in the context of chronic kidney disease. Will trend enzyme, repeat EKG, and monitor for changes in clinical status.
#) Edema : differential includes congestive heart failure vs worsening kidney disease vs iatrogenic volume overload vs capillary leak syndrome (from steroids, norvasc). Given duration, clinical picture, and elevated BNP (although no baseline comparison), concerning for CHF. Diagnostic evaluation: echocardiogram, TSH, etc. w/ more extensive evaluation as needed. Therapeutic intervention: will hold lasix given underlying kidney function, continue HCTZ, monitor I/Os.
